item.title: Yellow wheelie bin and piece of machinery fly tipped, 27th August
item.description:
Yellow wheelie bin and a large metal machine block have been dumped in the alley next to the commercial bins. Alleyway is to the left of 37 Kersley Road, N16 0NT.

item.title: Sewer Vent Odour Issue – Request for Council Support, 27th August
item.description:
There is a metal sewer vent next to a manhole in front of residential properties on Gurdon Road (SE7) which has been causing persistent and very unpleasant odours. Despite several reports to Thames Water, the problem remains unresolved. The smell is strong and continuous, affecting both the public area around the vent and the private homes nearby. On windy days, the odour drifts indoors, making it difficult for residents to open windows or use their outdoor space. We kindly ask Greenwich Council to investigate this issue and support in finding a solution, as Thames Water has been unable to address the problem so far.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 2, Gurdon Road, East Greenwich, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Overflowing litter bin, 27th August
item.description:
This bin has not been emptied for at least two and a half weeks. Dog waste bags all over the area, broken glass amongst the waste. Other bins nearby were emptied and this one ignored. HEALTH AND SAFETY ISSUE

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Erebus Drive, London
